intro: Alkanna stojanovii, commonly known as the Balkan alkanna, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its yellowish-orange flowers and has hairy, glandular leaves. It typically grows in rocky or dry habitats and is often found in mountainous areas. Alkanna stojanovii is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in herbal medicine.
